**Blue dragon scales** are a type of [body armor](/wiki/Body_armor "Body armor") that appear in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. They are made of [dragon hide](/wiki/Dragon_hide "Dragon hide") like all [dragon scales](/wiki/Dragon_scales "Dragon scales").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Description](#Description)

- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [4 History](#History)

- [5 Variants](#Variants)

  - [5.1 SporkHack](#SporkHack)
  - [5.2 UnNetHack](#UnNetHack)
  - [5.3 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [5.4 FIQHack](#FIQHack)

- [6 References](#References)

## Generation

Blue dragon scales are not randomly generated, though they can be [wished](/wiki/Wish "Wish") for or found in [bones](/wiki/Bones "Bones").

A [blue dragon](/wiki/Blue_dragon "Blue dragon") that leaves a [corpse](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse") behind on death (i.e. always, unless killed by [disintegration](/wiki/Disintegration "Disintegration")) has a 1⁄3 chance of leaving behind dragon scales, while a dragon revived by the [wand of undead turning](/wiki/Wand_of_undead_turning "Wand of undead turning") or [spell of turn undead](/wiki/Spell_of_turn_undead "Spell of turn undead") only has a 1⁄20 chance to leave behind scales.[\[1\]](#cite_note-scalegen-1) Blue dragon scales dropped this way are always generated +0 and uncursed.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

## Description

While worn, blue dragon scales confer 3 base [AC](/wiki/AC "AC") and [shock resistance](/wiki/Shock_resistance "Shock resistance"). Reading a non-cursed [scroll of enchant armor](/wiki/Scroll_of_enchant_armor "Scroll of enchant armor") that targets worn blue dragon scales will convert them into [blue dragon scale mail](/wiki/Blue_dragon_scale_mail "Blue dragon scale mail"), with a blessed scroll adding a point of [enchantment](/wiki/Enchantment "Enchantment").

Uncontrolled [polymorph](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") while wearing blue dragon scales will turn the wearer into a blue dragon, and doing so while wearing the scale mail will additionally revert them to scales.[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)[\[4\]](#cite_note-4)[\[5\]](#cite_note-5)

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([NetHack 3.7.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.7.0 "NetHack 3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

Per [commit 9942b65d](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/9942b65df78dd55a7806ec), extrinsic sources of an elemental resistance now has a 99⁄100 chance of protecting your inventory from that type of damage. Per [commit ef1eeed7](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/ef1eeed7550e38fa1e4ff0ef608f3c8b55eaa950), both the scales and scale mail also provide [slow digestion](/wiki/Slow_digestion "Slow digestion").

## Strategy

- *Main article: [Dragon scales#Strategy](/wiki/Dragon_scales#Strategy "Dragon scales")*

Blue dragon scales are rarely used by most characters: [reflection](/wiki/Reflection "Reflection") can protect against the [wand of lightning](/wiki/Wand_of_lightning "Wand of lightning") and the [lightning](/wiki/Lightning_\(monster_spell\) "Lightning (monster spell)") [monster spell](/wiki/Monster_spell "Monster spell"), and ranged attacks or another source of shock resistance can help avoid or protect from many of the rest. [Puddings](/wiki/Pudding "Pudding") and [gelatinous cubes](/wiki/Gelatinous_cube "Gelatinous cube") in particular may confer shock resistance to a character before they encounter a monster that deals non-reflectable shock damage, and other sources of the property (e.g. the [ring of shock resistance](/wiki/Ring_of_shock_resistance "Ring of shock resistance")) will often be encountered before blue dragons or their scales.

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([NetHack 3.7.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.7.0 "NetHack 3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

Blue dragon scales are more likely to be considered for characters due to providing extrinsic shock resistance and speed: extrinsic resistances are much more valuable, and a source of speed can potentially free up the [boots](/wiki/Boots "Boots") slot for other options.

## History

Blue dragon scales first appear with most other colors of dragon scales in [NetHack 3.1.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.1.0 "NetHack 3.1.0").

## Variants

- *Main article: [Dragon-scaled armor](/wiki/Dragon-scaled_armor "Dragon-scaled armor")*

In some variants, dragon scale mail is phased out in favor of dragon-scaled armor, whose implementation is based on a proposal by dtsund. Instead of being made into mail of its own, dragon scales are treated as a [cloak](/wiki/Cloak "Cloak"), and reading a scroll of enchant armor melds them onto a worn set of body armor, generally augmenting that armor by adding its AC and conferred extrinsic properties to it. Dragon-scaled armor is implemented in [NetHack Fourk](/wiki/NetHack_Fourk "NetHack Fourk"), [xNetHack](/wiki/XNetHack "XNetHack"), [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), and [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM").

Several variants also give blue dragon scales additional properties while worn, and may even introduce other forms of white dragon scale armor. Variants that implement partial intrinsics and/or [object properties](/wiki/Object_properties "Object properties") may also make blue dragon scales and other colors more worthwhile.

### SporkHack

In [SporkHack](/wiki/SporkHack "SporkHack"), worn blue dragon scales additionally confer extrinsic speed.

### UnNetHack

In [UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack"), dragon scales and dragon scale mail have randomized powers and [appearances](/wiki/Randomized_appearance "Randomized appearance") in each game - to [wish](/wiki/Wish "Wish") for dragon armor or scales by its corresponding power, either type of armor must be formally identified first, e.g. by using a [scroll of identify](/wiki/Scroll_of_identify "Scroll of identify") on dropped dragon scales (which identifies the matching scale mail along with it) or by witnessing the dragon use its breath weapon.

Blue dragon scales are effectively replaced by **electric dragon scales**, which confer only 1 base AC like all dragon scales in UnNetHack.

### dNetHack

- *Main article: [Dragon armor (dNetHack)](/wiki/Dragon_armor_\(dNetHack\) "Dragon armor (dNetHack)")*

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") and [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack"), worn blue dragon scales additionally confer extrinsic speed.

### FIQHack

In [FIQHack](/wiki/FIQHack "FIQHack"), worn white dragon scales additionally confer extrinsic speed and [protects against sources of slowing](/index.php?title=Slowing_resistance\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Slowing resistance (page does not exist)"). They also weigh 300 aum like all dragon scales in FIQHack (which is halved while worn).
